{{also|Werden}} ==Dutch== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nl|/ˈʋɛrdə(n)/}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-werden.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|nl|ɛrdən}} ===Verb=== {{head|nl|verb form}} # {{nl-verb form of|n=pl|t=past|m=ind+subj|worden}} ===Anagrams=== * {{l|nl|werend}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|wërden}}, from {{inh|de|goh|werdan}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*werþaną}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|worden}}, {{cog|sv|varda}}, obsolete {{cog|en|worth||to become}} and also with {{cog|la|vertere||to turn}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈveːɐ̯dn̩/}} * {{audio|de|De-werden.ogg|audio}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-irregular|wird|wurde|geworden|past participle 2=worden|auxiliary=sein}} # {{lb|de|auxiliary|with an infinitive|past participle {{m|de|geworden}}}} [[will]]; to be going (to do something); {{non-gloss definition|forms the future tense}} #: {{ux|de|Ich '''werde''' nach Hause gehen.|I '''will''' go home.}} # {{lb|de|auxiliary|with a past participle|past participle {{m|de|worden}}}} to be done; {{non-gloss definition|forms the passive voice}} #: ''Das Buch '''wird''' gerade gelesen. (present tense)'' #:: The book is '''being''' read. #: ''Er war geschlagen '''worden'''. (past perfect tense)'' #:: He had '''been''' beaten. # {{lb|de|intransitive|past participle: “[[geworden]]”}} to [[become]]; to [[get]]; to [[grow]]; to [[turn]] #: {{ux|de|Es '''wird''' heißer.|It's '''getting''' hotter.}} ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj|werden|[[werdend]]|[[geworden]], [[worden]]|s|[[werde]],

[[werd']] {{qualifier|dated or non-standard}}|[[werdet]]||a}} ---- ==Middle Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|dum|odt|werthan}}, from {{inh|dum|gem-pro|*werþaną}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|dum|/ˈwerdən/}} ===Verb=== {{dum-verb}} # to [[become]] # to [[happen]], to [[occur]] # to [[arise]], to [[form]] ====Inflection==== {{dum-conj-st|class=3|werd|ward|word|word}} ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|dum|worden}} {{qualifier|late}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|dum|verwerden}} ====Descendants==== * {{desctree|nl|worden}} * {{desc|li|waere}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:VMNW|ID60442|I}} * {{R:MNW|72450|II}} ---- ==Middle High German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gmh|goh|werdan}}, from {{inh|gmh|gem-pro|*werþaną}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|worden}} and obsolete {{cog|en|worth||to become}}. ===Verb=== {{head|gmh|verb|head=wërden}} # to [[become]] ====Conjugation==== {{gmh-conj-IIIb|w|rd}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|gsw|wërde}} *: {{desc|swg|werra}} * {{desc|gmw-cfr|wääde|alts=1}} * {{desc|de|werden}} * {{desc|lb|wäerten}} * {{desc|pdc|waerre}} * {{desc|yi|ווערן‎}} ---- ==Middle Low German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gml|osx|wērthan||to become}}, from {{inh|gml|gem-pro|*werþaną}}. ===Pronunciation=== * '''[[Wiktionary:About_Middle_Low_German#Stem_vowels|Stem vowel]]: ê²''' ** {{a|originally}} {{IPA|gml|/wɛːrdən/}} or {{IPA|gml|/wærdən/}} ** While the combination /rd/ originally lengthened the vowel in Old Saxon, in several Middle Low German dialects it was treated like a [[geminate#Noun|geminate]], or had actually become /r/, and in turn shortened long vowels occurring before it. Further, the vowel was shortened before /rt/ from [[final obstruent devoicing]]. Dialects then often begun to apply the more common vowel length across all forms. ===Verb=== {{head|gml|verb|head=wêrden|head2=werden}} # to [[become]] # [[auxiliary verb]] used to form the passive ====Conjugation==== {{gml-verb|w|3c|rd|}}
